author: Jon Azpiri
title: Vedder Mountain landslide in Chilliwack forces evacuation of 3 homes, road closure - BC | Globalnews.ca
text:
February 18, 2017 3:01 pm Updated: February 18, 2017 10:00 pm Vedder Mountain landslide in Chilliwack forces evacuation of 3 homes, road closure By Jon Azpiri Online News Producer Global News 
WATCH: It's been an alarming one for people living near a quarry in Chilliwack after the land above them suddenly gave way this morning. Global’s Paul Johnson has the latest from Chilliwack. What is this? 
Sponsored content is written by Global News' editorial staff without any editorial influence by the sponsor. If you'd like to learn more... X What is this? 
Sponsored content is written by Global News' without any editorial influence by the sponsor. If you'd like to learn more... - Listen 
A landslide on Chilliwack’s Vedder Mountain forced the evacuation of three homes on Saturday. 
Officials are concerned that the slide, which occurred near the top of the mountain, has dislodged some large boulders that could come crashing down at any moment. 
Vedder Mountain Road is closed from Chilliwack to Yarrow. 
Chilliwack Mayor Sharon Gaetz said there were no injuries and the homes were evacuated as a precaution. A geotech engineer is at the scene assessing the situation. 
Gaetz said a slide occurred in the same area back in 2009.
